short_summary: Convert existing Building Automation Systems (BAS) to a single system, while maintaining existing systems controlling research equipment.

full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Building Automation System Conversion
#### Invitation to Tender

**Notice**
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites bidders to submit a proposal for the conversion of the existing Building Automation Systems (BAS) at the Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) facility in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

**Reference and Solicitation Number**
WS4234494412. Tender number: WS4234494412. Solicitation number: WS4234494412.

**Tender Summary**

The procurement requires the conversion of the existing BAS systems controlling the original building and a portion of the expansion building into a single, integrated system. The new system must not impact the operation of the existing systems controlling research equipment (Delta System). The conversion will be undertaken in phases to ensure minimal disruption to building operations.

**Tender Closing Date**
October 17, 2023, at 2:00 PM Eastern Daylight Time (EDT). Late tenders will not be accepted.

**Site Visit**
An optional site visit has been scheduled for October 11, 2023, at 10:00 AM Central Time. Interested bidders must meet at the west entrance of 410 Lowe Road, Saskatoon, SK.

**Key Project Requirements**

* Conversion of existing BAS systems
* Integration of the systems without impacting the Delta System
* Phased construction to minimize building operation disruptions
* Coordination with Departmental Representative

**Important Information**

The trade agreements and regions of opportunity for this tender are Canadian Free Trade Agreement and None, respectively. The contracting entity is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).

**Contact Information**

Fisher, Drew (SPAC/PSPC) - drew.fisher@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Notice URL**

https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17590714?extsite=MTc1OTA3MTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

---

To make this text more concise and readable, the following formatting was employed:
	* Bullet points were used to list key project requirements and trade agreements, reducing unnecessary text.
	* Whitespace was used to separate sections for better organization and easy reading.
	* Indentations and headings were added to highlight key information and create a clear hierarchy of information.
	* Key project requirements and tender summary were written in a concise and professional manner to ensure essential details are communicated accurately and effectively.
